B1 a black and white bird, found mainly in the Antarctic, that cannot fly but uses its small wings to help it swim: What time do they feed the penguins at the zoo? Puffins are often confused with penguins. See also

More examplesFewer examplesThe bird population in the Antarctic region is about 350 million, half of which are penguins.Early in penguin evolution, the bones, especially in the wings and hind limbs, became thick and dense.Penguins are used to textures such as rock and water, so the nontoxic paint provides a different feeling on their feet.
